featuresSection.heading: Explore the Diverse Housing Options Available When You Buy house in Sector 86
description: Understanding the type of home that best suits your lifestyle and investment goals is crucial. Sector 86 offers housing solutions ranging from compact, modern independent floors to expansive luxury villas. Each property type is designed with attention to detail, providing high-quality finishes and optimal use of space.

Whether you are a young professional seeking a low-maintenance home or a large family requiring multiple bedrooms and private outdoor areas, Sector 86 has a perfect fit. Review our popular configurations below to help you Buy house in Sector 86 that aligns perfectly with your requirements.

features.title: 4 Marla Compact Homes
features.description: Ideal for small families or first-time homebuyers, 4 Marla (approximately 100 square yards) houses in Sector 86 offer efficient space utilization and affordability. These properties often feature 2BHK or small 3BHK layouts across multiple floors. They require minimal maintenance while providing all essential modern amenities. This size is popular for rental yield potential due to its economic price point and desirability among nuclear families looking to Buy house in Sector 86 near commercial centers.

features.title: 6 Marla Mid-Sized Residences
features.description: The 6 Marla segment offers a balance between space and budget, typically translating to spacious 3BHK independent houses or modern builder floors. These homes provide ample living areas, dedicated parking, and sometimes a small garden space. They are often situated in well-planned sub-localities within Sector 86, providing enhanced community living and excellent security features. This size is highly sought after by established families aiming to upgrade their living standards.

features.title: 8 Marla Premium Independent Houses
features.description: When you choose to Buy house in Sector 86 in the 8 Marla category, you are opting for significant space and luxury. These houses usually accommodate spacious 4BHK configurations, servant quarters, and large balconies. The architectural design often incorporates higher-end finishes, modular kitchens, and private terraces. These residences are perfect for families who value privacy, large gatherings, and the comfort of owning a substantial independent unit.

features.title: 10 Marla Luxury Villas
features.description: These expansive units are designed for executive living and offer unparalleled luxury within Sector 86. A 10 Marla home typically includes 5BHK+ layouts, often featuring double-height living rooms, dedicated office spaces, and private elevators. The properties are typically located in exclusive gated enclaves, offering superior safety and community amenities like clubhouses and sports facilities. This segment is reserved for buyers seeking a flagship home investment.

features.title: 12 Marla Custom Built Residences
features.description: The 12 Marla size caters to buyers who prefer personalization and extensive space. These houses provide maximum flexibility for bespoke interior design and landscaping. When you Buy house in Sector 86 of this size, you are investing in potential future expansion and true independence. These large residences are often surrounded by lush green spaces and provide ample room for private pools or large home theaters, representing the pinnacle of residential luxury.

features.title: 14 Marla Estate Homes
features.description: Representing the largest category, 14 Marla properties are exclusive estate homes offering massive square footage. They are designed for multigenerational families and those requiring the ultimate in privacy and opulence. These houses typically feature lavish gardens, multiple parking bays, and sophisticated smart home technology integration. This category offers the highest investment returns due to scarcity and high demand for large, quality-built homes in this prime sector.

faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About How to Buy house in Sector 86 Gurugram
faqSection.description: Get detailed answers to the most common queries buyers have regarding property valuation, legal documentation, and life in Sector 86.

faqs.question: What is the typical price range if I want to Buy house in Sector 86 Gurugram
faqs.answer: The price range for houses in Sector 86 varies significantly based on the property type, size, and specific project amenities. For high-end builder floors or independent houses, prices generally start from INR 1.5 Crores and can go upwards of INR 5 Crores for large, luxury villas or established independent bungalows. Factors influencing the final price include the floor location, age of the construction, and the premium associated with the specific developer. We recommend consulting our pricing expert for the latest market rates based on your specific needs.

faqs.question: Is Sector 86 considered a good long-term investment location
faqs.answer: Yes, Sector 86 is widely regarded as an excellent long-term investment location. Its prime position in New Gurugram, coupled with rapid infrastructure enhancements like the operational Dwarka Expressway link, ensures strong capital appreciation. Government focus on developing this corridor guarantees sustained commercial and residential influx. Investors benefit from both appreciation and consistent rental demand driven by nearby corporate hubs, confirming its status as a robust real estate investment.

faqs.question: What are the common house types available for purchase in Sector 86
faqs.answer: Sector 86 offers a variety of housing options catering to different preferences. The most common types include independent builder floors (2BHK, 3BHK, and 4BHK configurations), plotted houses built on residential land parcels (villas and bungalows), and cooperative group housing society apartments. The independent house segment is particularly popular here, offering more control over design and space compared to high-rise apartments.

faqs.question: Are properties in Sector 86 typically RERA registered and safe to purchase
faqs.answer: The majority of reputable and large-scale residential projects and planned independent floor developments in Sector 86 are mandatorily RERA registered. We strongly advise buyers to only consider RERA-compliant projects. RERA registration ensures transparency, regulates builder-buyer agreements, secures buyer funds in escrow accounts, and guarantees timely project completion. Always verify the RERA number before finalizing your decision to Buy house in Sector 86.

faqs.question: How is the water and electricity supply infrastructure in Sector 86
faqs.answer: Sector 86 benefits from reliable municipal water supply connections provided by the relevant authorities. Most modern housing societies and independent complexes also incorporate supplementary water treatment and storage facilities. Electricity supply is generally stable, with most upscale residences providing 100% power backup via generators or sophisticated inverters, minimizing disruption and ensuring comfortable living year-round.

faqs.question: What are the best commuting options from Sector 86 to Cyber City or MG Road
faqs.answer: Commuting from Sector 86 to major commercial areas is efficient. The Dwarka Expressway provides the fastest route to Cyber City, typically taking around 30 to 45 minutes depending on peak traffic. Alternatively, the NH-48 offers direct access to MG Road and central Gurugram. Taxis, cab aggregators, and robust public transport options are readily available, further streamlining daily commutes for residents working in these hubs.

faqs.question: Can foreigners or NRIs legally Buy house in Sector 86 Gurugram
faqs.answer: Yes, Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) and Persons of Indian Origin (PIOs) are legally permitted to Buy house in Sector 86 and other residential properties in India, subject to the regulations set by the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA). Foreign citizens who are not PIOs generally need specific Reserve Bank of India (RBI) approval, although certain categories may be exempt. We provide specialized legal assistance for NRI clients navigating the purchasing process.

faqs.question: What essential documents are required for property registration after I decide to Buy house in Sector 86
faqs.answer: Essential documents for property registration include the Sale Deed, necessary stamp duty payment proofs, clearance certificates from the municipal corporation (NOCs), the Occupancy Certificate (OC) if applicable, and the property tax receipts up to the date of sale. Buyers must also present identity and address proofs, along with the approved building plan. Having a professional legal team manage this ensures a smooth and error-free registration process.

faqs.question: Are there good educational institutions near the houses in Sector 86
faqs.answer: Sector 86 enjoys excellent proximity to several top-tier schools and educational institutions. Renowned names like DPS Sector 84, Amity Global School, and various high-quality primary schools are easily accessible, often within a 10-15 minute drive. This convenience makes Sector 86 highly attractive for families with school-going children, ensuring a safe and manageable school run.

faqs.question: What makes independent houses in Sector 86 a better choice than apartments
faqs.answer: Independent houses in Sector 86 offer several distinct advantages over apartments, primarily greater privacy, ownership of the land component, freedom to customize the structure (within legal limits), and significantly lower monthly maintenance charges compared to large society dues. They often provide larger built-up areas and private outdoor space, leading to a higher quality of life and generally stronger long-term capital appreciation.
